name: Ajani Goldmane
text:
+1: You gain 2 life.
−1: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. Those creatures gain vigilance until end of turn.
−6: Put a white Avatar creature token onto the battlefield. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to your life total.
title: Ajani Goldmane

flavor:
Until that day I cursed the angels, those uncaring lights in the sky. They rewarded my scorn with the gift of time, every year of which I've spent in devotion to their names."
—Torian Sha, soul warden
name: Angel's Mercy
text: You gain 7 life.
title: Angel's Mercy

flavor: The meadow sprang up beneath me, and I perceived a path from our people's defeat to our highest glory.
name: Armored Ascension
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Plains you control and has flying.
title: Armored Ascension

flavor: Some angels protect the meek and innocent. Others seek out and smite evil wherever it lurks.
name: Baneslayer Angel
text: Flying, first strike, lifelink, protection from Demons and from Dragons
title: Baneslayer Angel

flavor: I carry the light of truth. Do not pity those it blinds, for they never had eyes to see.
name: Blinding Mage
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
title: Blinding Mage

name: Captain of the Watch
text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.
When Captain of the Watch enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
title: Captain of the Watch

flavor:
We see clearly the error of your ways. It does not matter that you choose not to."
—Urien of the Lightwielders
name: Celestial Purge
text: Exile target black or red permanent.
title: Celestial Purge

flavor: Giants and pit spawn attempted to topple the cathedral's pillars. The fine grit of their remains still swirls in the breeze outside.
name: Divine Verdict
text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.
title: Divine Verdict

flavor: The vanguard is skilled at waging war alone. The enemy is often defeated before its reinforcements reach the front.
name: Elite Vanguard
title: Elite Vanguard

flavor:
Our law prohibits capital punishment. We believe even the gravest offenders have the chance to redeem themselves."
—Torian Sha, soul warden
name: Excommunicate
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
title: Excommunicate

flavor:
One's blade is only as sharp as one's conviction."
—Ajani Goldmane
name: Glorious Charge
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
title: Glorious Charge

flavor: Once a griffin sentinel adopts a territory as its own, only death can force it to betray its post.
name: Griffin Sentinel
text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
title: Griffin Sentinel

flavor: Her gaze prevents the petty sins and her sword punishes the rest.
name: Guardian Seraph
text:
Flying
If a source an opponent controls would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
title: Guardian Seraph

flavor: Even when fate is already written, there's always time to change the names.
name: Harm's Way
text: The next 2 damage that a source of your choice would deal to you and/or permanents you control this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.
title: Harm's Way

flavor:
Born under the sun, the first child will seek the foundation of honor and be fortified by its righteousness."
—Codex of the Constellari
name: Holy Strength
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
title: Holy Strength

flavor: Together the soldiers were like a golden blade, cutting down their enemies and scarring the darkness.
name: Honor of the Pure
text: White creatures you control get +1/+1.
title: Honor of the Pure

name: Indestructibility
text:
Enchant permanent
Enchanted permanent has indestructible. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy that permanent. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)
title: Indestructibility

flavor: The spoils of war are not measured only in gold and silver.
name: Lifelink
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
title: Lifelink

name: Lightwielder Paladin
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever Lightwielder Paladin deals combat damage to a player, you may exile target black or red permanent that player controls.
title: Lightwielder Paladin

flavor: She shepherds mysteries and dust as others would a flock of sheep.
name: Mesa Enchantress
text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
title: Mesa Enchantress

flavor: When the vaults are empty, everyone is rich.
name: Open the Vaults
text: Return all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards to the battlefield under their owners' control. (Auras with nothing to enchant remain in graveyards.)
title: Open the Vaults

flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.
name: Pacifism
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
title: Pacifism

flavor: I'm not nearly as bothered by being outnumbered as I am by their foul stench.
name: Palace Guard
text: Palace Guard can block any number of creatures.
title: Palace Guard

name: Planar Cleansing
text: Destroy all nonland permanents.
title: Planar Cleansing

flavor: Like a meteor, it strikes from above without warning. Unlike a meteor, it then carries you off and eats you.
name: Razorfoot Griffin
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
title: Razorfoot Griffin

flavor: When the rhoxes charge, everyone else knows which way to run.
name: Rhox Pikemaster
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Other Soldier creatures you control have first strike.
title: Rhox Pikemaster

flavor: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.
name: Righteousness
text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
title: Righteousness

flavor: With one flap of her wings, the angel beat back the fires of war.
name: Safe Passage
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and creatures you control this turn.
title: Safe Passage

flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.
name: Serra Angel
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
title: Serra Angel

flavor:
Defending the citadel is easy. I just take these big fellows outside the main gate and let the enemy take a good long look."
—Mastodon keeper
name: Siege Mastodon
title: Siege Mastodon

flavor:
All the wizardry in the world has to pass through one small and easily sealed door."
—Ajani Goldmane
name: Silence
text: Your opponents can't cast spells this turn. (Spells cast before this resolves are unaffected.)
title: Silence

flavor: Hunters of every species on the savannah, silvercoats disdain camouflage in favor of total dominance of the food chain.
name: Silvercoat Lion
title: Silvercoat Lion

flavor:
A relic donation is suggested."
"The suggestion is mandatory."
—Temple signs
name: Solemn Offering
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.
title: Solemn Offering

flavor: One does not question the size or shape of the grains of sand in an hourglass. Nor do I question the temperament of the souls under my guidance.
name: Soul Warden
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
title: Soul Warden

flavor:
At summer's end, the pegasus herd stampedes across the sky. Their silent footfalls taunt the clouds and bid the rains to come."
—Stormfront fable
name: Stormfront Pegasus
text: Flying
title: Stormfront Pegasus

flavor: Let everything return to its true nature, so that destiny may take its course.
name: Tempest of Light
text: Destroy all enchantments.
title: Tempest of Light

flavor: My motive is not vengeance but mercy. I deliver the soulless back to their severed souls.
name: Undead Slayer
text: {W}, {T}: Exile target Skeleton, Vampire, or Zombie.
title: Undead Slayer

flavor: Courage is a proud and gleaming shield. It does not bend or hide from sight. To fight with courage, we must forge in steel.
name: Veteran Armorsmith
text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +0/+1.
title: Veteran Armorsmith

flavor: Truth is a straight, keen edge. There are no soft angles or rounded edges. To fight for truth, we must forge in steel.
name: Veteran Swordsmith
text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+0.
title: Veteran Swordsmith

flavor:
This is a fine suit, armorsmith. I will be safe from harm. If only you could forge rings to mail the rest of my people . . ."
—Lord Hilneth
name: Wall of Faith
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{W}: Wall of Faith gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
title: Wall of Faith

name: White Knight
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
title: White Knight

flavor:
The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab."
—Joseph Conrad, The Mirror of the Sea
name: Air Elemental
text: Flying
title: Air Elemental

flavor:
The ground polluted floats with human gore,
And human carnage taints the dreadful shore
Fly swift the dangerous coast: let every ear
Be stopp'd against the song! 'tis death to hear!"
—Homer, The Odyssey, trans. Pope
name: Alluring Siren
text: {T}: Target creature an opponent controls attacks you this turn if able.
title: Alluring Siren

name: Cancel
text: Counter target spell.
title: Cancel

flavor: The shapeshifter mimics with a twin's esteem and a mirror's cruelty.
name: Clone
text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.
title: Clone

flavor: Where are we? You must learn to ask more useful questions than that.
name: Convincing Mirage
text:
Enchant land
As Convincing Mirage enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.
title: Convincing Mirage

flavor: Merfolk are best known for their subtle magic. But those who try to fight them in their own territory quickly realize that merfolk are hardly defenseless on the field of battle.
name: Coral Merfolk
title: Coral Merfolk

flavor:
If it has a brain, even a primitive one, we can most surely scramble it."
—Garild, merfolk mage
name: Disorient
text: Target creature gets -7/-0 until end of turn.
title: Disorient

flavor:
The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle
name: Divination
text: Draw two cards.
title: Divination

name: Djinn of Wishes
text:
Flying
Djinn of Wishes enters the battlefield with three wish counters on it.
{2}{U}{U}, Remove a wish counter from Djinn of Wishes: Reveal the top card of your library. You may play that card without paying its mana cost. If you don't, exile it.
title: Djinn of Wishes

flavor: Some wizards compete not to summon the most interesting creatures, but to create the most interesting aftereffects when a summons goes awry.
name: Essence Scatter
text: Counter target creature spell.
title: Essence Scatter

flavor:
I'm one masterpiece away from ruling this pathetic world."
—Saldrath, master artificer
name: Fabricate
text: Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
title: Fabricate

flavor:
Your downfall was not your ignorance, your weakness, or your hubris, but your warm blood."
—Heidar, Rimewind master
name: Flashfreeze
text: Counter target red or green spell.
title: Flashfreeze

flavor:
All consciousness is one, separated only by a thin veil of the physical."
—Jace Beleren
name: Hive Mind
text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player copies that spell. Each of those players may choose new targets for his or her copy.
title: Hive Mind

flavor: It's a mistake to say turtles hide in their shells. They merely need time to contemplate how best to bite your head off.
name: Horned Turtle
title: Horned Turtle

name: Ice Cage
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy Ice Cage.
title: Ice Cage

flavor:
Illusion is a handy but fragile medium. Use it only in a pinch, or against the dim-witted."
—Jace Beleren
name: Illusionary Servant
text:
Flying
When Illusionary Servant becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
title: Illusionary Servant

name: Jace Beleren
text:
+2: Each player draws a card.
−1: Target player draws a card.
−10: Target player puts the top twenty cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
title: Jace Beleren

flavor:
Humanity has always envied the power of flight. So we took it."
—Scytha, aeromage
name: Jump
text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
title: Jump

flavor: The horses of Scytha's army must be well trained. A thrown rider would fall miles before meeting the ground.
name: Levitation
text: Creatures you control have flying.
title: Levitation

flavor: Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.
name: Merfolk Looter
text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
title: Merfolk Looter

flavor: The sharks envy our ferocity. The eels envy our cunning.
name: Merfolk Sovereign
text:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Target Merfolk creature can't be blocked this turn.
title: Merfolk Sovereign

flavor:
Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
—Jace Beleren
name: Mind Control
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
title: Mind Control

flavor: Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.
name: Mind Spring
text: Draw X cards.
title: Mind Spring

flavor: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.
name: Negate
text: Counter target noncreature spell.
title: Negate

flavor:
The construction of a defense is not accomplished by adding bricks."
—Jace Beleren
name: Phantom Warrior
text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
title: Phantom Warrior

name: Polymorph
text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.
title: Polymorph

flavor: Tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.
name: Ponder
text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.
title: Ponder

flavor: Some owls house the souls of archmages of ages past.
name: Sage Owl
text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
title: Sage Owl

name: Serpent of the Endless Sea
text:
Serpent of the Endless Sea's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Islands you control.
Serpent of the Endless Sea can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
title: Serpent of the Endless Sea

flavor:
I give them dreams so wondrous that they hesitate to return to the world of the conscious."
—Garild, merfolk mage
name: Sleep
text: Tap all creatures target player controls. Those creatures don't untap during that player's next untap step.
title: Sleep

flavor: Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.
name: Snapping Drake
text: Flying
title: Snapping Drake

name: Sphinx Ambassador
text:
Flying
Whenever Sphinx Ambassador deals combat damage to a player, search that player's library for a card, then that player names a card. If you searched for a creature card that isn't the named card, you may put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
title: Sphinx Ambassador

flavor:
The most disappointing thing about learning telepathy is finding out how boring people really are."
—Teferi, fourth-level student
name: Telepathy
text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
title: Telepathy

flavor: Just when you thought you'd survived the first wave.
name: Time Warp
text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
title: Time Warp

flavor: Genius is overrated, especially when it's someone else's.
name: Tome Scour
text: Target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
title: Tome Scour

flavor:
The educated mind is heavy with lore and knowledge. It's also the most likely to collapse under its own weight."
—Ambassador Laquatus
name: Traumatize
text: Target player puts the top half of his or her library, rounded down, into his or her graveyard.
title: Traumatize

flavor: Imitation is the most dangerous form of flattery.
name: Twincast
text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
title: Twincast

flavor: Mages routinely summon creatures from the Æther. It's only fair that they occasionally throw one back.
name: Unsummon
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
title: Unsummon

flavor:
I welcome it. The pasture is cleared of weeds and the wolves are frozen solid."
—Lumi, goatherd
name: Wall of Frost
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Frost blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
title: Wall of Frost

flavor: A smaller cousin to the dragon, drakes are often seen at the side of powerful wizards who use them as airborne eyes and ears.
name: Wind Drake
text: Flying
title: Wind Drake

flavor: I've never understood why so many beings lumber around on the ground. There are three dimensions, yet they use only two.
name: Zephyr Sprite
text: Flying
title: Zephyr Sprite

flavor: Like all priests, she gives her blessings only to those truly worthy of them.
name: Acolyte of Xathrid
text: {1}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life.
title: Acolyte of Xathrid

flavor:
This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin
name: Assassinate
text: Destroy target tapped creature.
title: Assassinate

name: Black Knight
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
title: Black Knight

flavor: She died in this swamp, and so will you.
name: Bog Wraith
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
title: Bog Wraith

flavor: Every grave cradles a recruit.
name: Cemetery Reaper
text:
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
{2}{B}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
title: Cemetery Reaper

flavor: A vampire enacts vengeance on the entire world, claiming her debt two tiny pinpricks at a time.
name: Child of Night
text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
title: Child of Night

name: Consume Spirit
text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.
title: Consume Spirit

flavor: Even the noblest of intentions and strongest of wills inevitably crumble into dust.
name: Deathmark
text: Destroy target green or white creature.
title: Deathmark

flavor: The wise always keep an ear open to the whispers of power.
name: Diabolic Tutor
text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
title: Diabolic Tutor

flavor:
Stop complaining. You can rest when you're dead. Oh—sorry."
—Liliana Vess
name: Disentomb
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
title: Disentomb

flavor: The void is without substance but cuts like steel.
name: Doom Blade
text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
title: Doom Blade

flavor: I don't know who to pity more: those who flee from my presence or the damned who can withstand it.
name: Dread Warlock
text: Dread Warlock can't be blocked except by black creatures.
title: Dread Warlock

flavor:
The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook
name: Drudge Skeletons
text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
title: Drudge Skeletons

flavor:
Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."
—Liliana Vess
name: Duress
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
title: Duress

flavor: Oddly, no one questioned the Cabal's wisdom in hiring a zombie to work at the cemetery.
name: Gravedigger
text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
title: Gravedigger

name: Haunting Echoes
text: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard other than basic land cards. For each card exiled this way, search that player's library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
title: Haunting Echoes

flavor: Villagers cloaked the town in magical silence, but their ears still bled.
name: Howling Banshee
text:
Flying
When Howling Banshee enters the battlefield, each player loses 3 life.
title: Howling Banshee

flavor: Its victims are known by their eyes: shattered vessels leaking broken dreams.
name: Hypnotic Specter
text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
title: Hypnotic Specter

flavor: The nesting bats of Kelinore sleep soundly while the sun passes, nestled among their grisly collections.
name: Kelinore Bat
text: Flying
title: Kelinore Bat

name: Liliana Vess
text:
+1: Target player discards a card.
−2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
−8: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.
title: Liliana Vess

flavor: Its form never rests, propelled by some undetectable gale from beyond the gloom.
name: Looming Shade
text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
title: Looming Shade

flavor:
It's a vicious circle. Stress breeds pain. Pain breeds stress. It's simply beautiful, wouldn't you agree?"
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus
name: Megrim
text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
title: Megrim

flavor:
The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath
name: Mind Rot
text: Target player discards two cards.
title: Mind Rot

flavor: Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.
name: Mind Shatter
text: Target player discards X cards at random.
title: Mind Shatter

flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.
name: Nightmare
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
title: Nightmare

name: Relentless Rats
text:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.
title: Relentless Rats

flavor:
Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess
name: Rise from the Grave
text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
title: Rise from the Grave

flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.
name: Royal Assassin
text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
title: Royal Assassin

flavor:
Blood is constant. Every drop I drink, someone must bleed."
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus
name: Sanguine Bond
text: Whenever you gain life, target opponent loses that much life.
title: Sanguine Bond

flavor:
You know I accept only one currency here, and yet you have sought me out. Why now do you hesitate?"
—Xathrid demon
name: Sign in Blood
text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.
title: Sign in Blood

flavor: Whether the end comes swift or slow, it always comes too soon.
name: Soul Bleed
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player loses 1 life.
title: Soul Bleed

flavor: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.
name: Tendrils of Corruption
text: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.
title: Tendrils of Corruption

flavor:
In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore
name: Underworld Dreams
text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.
title: Underworld Dreams

flavor:
Born under the moon, the second child will stumble on temptation and seek power in the dark places of the heart."
—Codex of the Constellari
name: Unholy Strength
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
title: Unholy Strength

flavor: I admit, I am a creature of the city. The sights, the nightly excitement, the abundance of fine drink . . .
name: Vampire Aristocrat
text: Sacrifice a creature: Vampire Aristocrat gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
title: Vampire Aristocrat

flavor: Your life will set with the sun.
name: Vampire Nocturnus
text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is black, Vampire Nocturnus and other Vampire creatures you control get +2/+1 and have flying.
title: Vampire Nocturnus

name: Wall of Bone
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
title: Wall of Bone

flavor: The battle was over, but the carnage continued for days.
name: Warpath Ghoul
title: Warpath Ghoul

flavor: For strength to have any meaning, there must also be . . . you.
name: Weakness
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
title: Weakness

name: Xathrid Demon
text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Xathrid Demon, then each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power. If you can't sacrifice a creature, tap Xathrid Demon and you lose 7 life.
title: Xathrid Demon

flavor:
Phirax of Blood Ridge has sent a war giant at us? What, do I have to spell it out for you? Kill the giant, scoop out its skull, and drive it back to Blood Ridge. Honestly, what kind of necromancer minions are you?"
—Keren-Dur, necromancer lord
name: Zombie Goliath
title: Zombie Goliath

flavor:
Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison."
—Sarkhan Vol
name: Act of Treason
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
title: Act of Treason

name: Ball Lightning
text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.
title: Ball Lightning

flavor: They take a blood oath to die in battle. So far none have failed to fulfill the promise.
name: Berserkers of Blood Ridge
text: Berserkers of Blood Ridge attacks each turn if able.
title: Berserkers of Blood Ridge

name: Bogardan Hellkite
text:
Flash
Flying
When Bogardan Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
title: Bogardan Hellkite

flavor: Jariad burned the midnight oil, burned through scroll after scroll, and then burned down his laboratory.
name: Burning Inquiry
text: Each player draws three cards, then discards three cards at random.
title: Burning Inquiry

flavor: Great generals inspire by example. Goblin chieftains inspire by electrifying the barracks.
name: Burst of Speed
text: Creatures you control gain haste until end of turn. (They can attack and {T} even if they just came under your control.)
title: Burst of Speed

flavor:
We'll scale these cliffs, traverse Brittle Bridge, and then fight our way down the volcanic slopes on the other side."
"Isn't the shortest route through the canyon?"
"Yes."
"So shouldn't we—"
"No.
name: Canyon Minotaur
title: Canyon Minotaur

flavor: You wish for great destruction? It is done, my master.
name: Capricious Efreet
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose target nonland permanent you control and up to two target nonland permanents you don't control. Destroy one of them at random.
title: Capricious Efreet

name: Chandra Nalaar
text:
+1: Chandra Nalaar deals 1 damage to target player.
−X: Chandra Nalaar deals X damage to target creature.
−8: Chandra Nalaar deals 10 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.
title: Chandra Nalaar

name: Dragon Whelp
text:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.
title: Dragon Whelp

flavor: They fell screaming into the depths of the chasm like so many pebbles tossed down a well.
name: Earthquake
text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
title: Earthquake

flavor: Once a barbarian army has conquered a region, their shamans summon hellhounds that keep undesirables out and prisoners in.
name: Fiery Hellhound
text: {R}: Fiery Hellhound gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
title: Fiery Hellhound

name: Fireball
text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
title: Fireball

flavor: The mage breathed in life-giving air and breathed out death-bringing fire.
name: Firebreathing
text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
title: Firebreathing

flavor: Most goblins get their turn firing the catapult, but few achieve the coveted title of Ammunition Holder.
name: Goblin Artillery
text: {T}: Goblin Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
title: Goblin Artillery

flavor: We are goblinkind, heirs to the mountain empires of chieftains past. Rest is death to us, and arson is our call to war.
name: Goblin Chieftain
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 and have haste.
title: Goblin Chieftain

flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.
name: Goblin Piker
title: Goblin Piker

flavor: The shaman prowled the academy halls, shaking his head at the pomp and babble of the sages inside. He knew just the spell to liven the place up.
name: Ignite Disorder
text: Ignite Disorder deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target white and/or blue creatures.
title: Ignite Disorder

flavor:
Those who wish to invade our monastery, please take it up with my servant."
—Chandra Nalaar
name: Inferno Elemental
text: Whenever Inferno Elemental blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Inferno Elemental deals 3 damage to that creature.
title: Inferno Elemental

flavor:
Let the gray-hairs keep their ravens and drakes. My familiar will be a reflection of me: bloodthirsty, with a predator's instinct."
—Taivang, barbarian warlord
name: Jackal Familiar
text: Jackal Familiar can't attack or block alone.
title: Jackal Familiar

flavor:
Rage is a dangerous weapon. Your enemies will try to use your anger against you. Use it against them first."
—Ajani Goldmane
name: Kindled Fury
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
title: Kindled Fury

flavor: Catch!
name: Lava Axe
text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
title: Lava Axe

flavor: The sparkmage shrieked, calling on the rage of the storms of his youth. To his surprise, the sky responded with a fierce energy he'd never thought to see again.
name: Lightning Bolt
text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
title: Lightning Bolt

flavor:
A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality
name: Lightning Elemental
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
title: Lightning Elemental

name: Magma Phoenix
text:
Flying
When Magma Phoenix dies, it deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
{3}{R}{R}: Return Magma Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand.
title: Magma Phoenix

flavor:
I don't know why people say a double-edged sword is bad. It's a sword. With two edges."
—Kamahl, pit fighter
name: Manabarbs
text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.
title: Manabarbs

flavor:
What do they see in the throes of panic? I'm not sure I want to know."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer
name: Panic Attack
text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
title: Panic Attack

flavor: What am I looking at? Ashes, dead man.
name: Prodigal Pyromancer
text: {T}: Prodigal Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
title: Prodigal Pyromancer

flavor:
Who'd want to ignite things one at a time?"
—Chandra Nalaar
name: Pyroclasm
text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
title: Pyroclasm

flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
name: Raging Goblin
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
title: Raging Goblin

flavor:
Life up here is simple. Adapt to the ways of the mountains and they will reward you. Fight them and they will end you."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer
name: Seismic Strike
text: Seismic Strike deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
title: Seismic Strike

flavor: Days of planning. Weeks of building. Months of perfecting. Seconds of smashing.
name: Shatter
text: Destroy target artifact.

flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.
name: Shivan Dragon

Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

text:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

flavor: Sparkmages are performance artists of sorts, but pain is the price of admission.
name: Sparkmage Apprentice
text: When Sparkmage Apprentice enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
title: Sparkmage Apprentice

flavor: A typical day for a giant. A momentous event for a goat.
name: Stone Giant
text: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
title: Stone Giant

flavor: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack. They need signals to tell them when to stop.
name: Trumpet Blast
text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
title: Trumpet Blast

flavor: Viashino lack the majesty of their draconic ancestors, but they lash out with equal rage and twice the spite.
name: Viashino Spearhunter

flavor: Mercy is for those who keep their distance.
name: Wall of Fire
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
title: Wall of Fire

name: Warp World
text: Each player shuffles all permanents he or she owns into his or her library, then reveals that many cards from the top of his or her library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield, then does the same for enchantment cards, then puts all cards revealed this way that weren't put onto the battlefield on the bottom of his or her library.
title: Warp World

flavor: The mapmaker scowled. He sighed, unrolled his parchment, and painted a large black blob where the Eternal Meadow was once marked.
name: Yawning Fissure
text: Each opponent sacrifices a land.
title: Yawning Fissure

name: Acidic Slime
text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Acidic Slime enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

flavor:
Kill the queen first, or we'll be fighting her drones forever. It is not in a queen's nature to have enough servants."
—Borzard, exterminator captain
name: Ant Queen
text: {1}{G}: Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token onto the battlefield.
title: Ant Queen

flavor: The druids of Mazar treat each seedcone with respect for the warrior it will become.
name: Awakener Druid
text: When Awakener Druid enters the battlefield, target Forest becomes a 4/5 green Treefolk creature for as long as Awakener Druid remains on the battlefield. It's still a land.

text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

flavor: Only fools and bandits use roads.
name: Borderland Ranger
text: When Borderland Ranger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

flavor: Following the sun's cycle, harvest season comes once a year—unless the druids bid the sun behave otherwise.
name: Bountiful Harvest
text: You gain 1 life for each land you control.
title: Bountiful Harvest

flavor:
I've seen the fully grown ones tear a baloth to gory ribbons in seconds."
—Kivi, thornberry harvester
name: Bramble Creeper
text: Whenever Bramble Creeper attacks, it gets +5/+0 until end of turn.
title: Bramble Creeper

flavor:
The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate
name: Centaur Courser
title: Centaur Courser

flavor: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.
name: Craw Wurm
title: Craw Wurm

text: {G}: Regenerate Cudgel Troll. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.

From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching
name: Elvish Piper
text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

flavor: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.

Enchant tapped creature

flavor:
I fear no army or beast, but only the morning fog. Our assault can survive everything else."
—Lord Hilneth

Do not fire upon it—it is bad luck. And a waste of arrows."
—Alera Benath, Kalonian ranger

One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.

May your weapon be no sword forged. May your armor be no metal wrought.
—Elvish saying

I can't claim to hunt all creatures. There are some things in the jungle that simply can't be hunted."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

flavor: If you want to destroy something lifeless, make it live.
name: Naturalize

When the beast cloaks itself in the mighty oak, what good is a bow? When the oak wraps itself around the snarling beast, what good is a hatchet?"
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

Enchant creature

name: Overrun

The desire for its magic horn inspires such bloodthirsty greed that all who see the unicorn will kill to possess it."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

Sometimes I wonder if our weapons and armor are a step backward."
—Soron, rhox pikemaster
name: Stampeding Rhino

flavor:
We don't like interlopers and thieves cluttering our skies."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid
